BodyName: Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Smith, S.7413-A, and Committee on Rules, A.11373-A, “AN ACT to authorize retroactive membership in tier one of the New York city teachers’ retirement system for Rose Treiber”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Authorize retroactive membership in tier one of the New York city teachers' retirement system (S.7413-A, A.11373-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.7154, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10279, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to provisional appointments”.
Items.MatterName: Provisional appointments (S.7154, A.10279)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.7163, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10280, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to coverage for additional members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Coverage for additional members of the New York City employees' retirement system (S.7163, A.10280)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2936-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, et al, A.5915-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the crediting of prior service by the police pension fund of such city”.
Items.MatterName: Crediting of prior service by the police pension fund (S.2936-A, A.5915-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.6974, and Committee on Rules, A.10886-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to eligibility for benefits payable by the firefighters’ variable supplements fund”.
Items.MatterName: Eligibility for benefits payable by the firefighters' variable supplements fund (S.6974, A.10886-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Golden, Maltese, Marchi and Velella, S.2564-D, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Ortiz, Pheffer, Seddio, Seminerio and McLaughlin, et al, A.5464-D, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty year retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as investigators by district attorneys’ offices”.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a twenty year retirement program (S.2564-D, A.5464-D)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in relation  to  the rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating  contributions  to the  New  York  city  employees'  retirement system, the New York city teachers' retirement system, the police pension fund, subchapter  two, the  fire  department  pension  fund,  subchapter two and the board of education retirement system of such city by public employers and other obligors required to make employer contributions  to  such  retirement systems, and the crediting of special interest and additional interest to members of such retirement systems, and the allowance of supplementary interest on the funds of such retirement systems." A.11225 / S.7467
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating  contributions  to the  NYC  employees'  retirement system (A.11225/S.7467)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue certain land as park land" A.11375 / S.7432
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Authorize the city of New York to discontinue certain land as park land" (A.11375/S.7432)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.7457, and Committee on Rules, A.11487, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the additional member contributions payable by participants in the twenty-five year retirement programs for certain members of the uniformed force of the New York City department of correction established pursuant to article 14 of such law, and in relation to the establishment of a twenty-year retirement program for certain members of such uniformed correction force of such city who are subject to article 14 of such law; and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing for employer pick up, pursuant to provisions of the federal internal revenue code, of certain additional member contributions required to be made by participants in such twenty-year retirement program”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law (S.7457/ A.11487)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Padavan, S.4186-B, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7163-B, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund (S.4186-B, A.7163-B)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in relation  to  providing  excess benefit plans for certain retirees and other beneficiaries of the New York city employees' retirement system, the New York city teachers'  retirement  system,  the  police  pension fund, subchapter two, and the fire department pension fund, subchapter two  of  such  city;  and  to  amend the education law, in relation to providing an excess benefit plan for certain retirees and other  beneficiaries of the board of education retirement system of such city." A.11419 / S.7466
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Providing  excess benefit plans for certain retirees and other beneficiaries of the NYC employees' retirement system (A.11419/S.7466)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Andrews, S.5927-A, and Assembly Member Norman, A.9413-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Doreen Harris, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 4802, Lot No. 36 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: In rem, Doreen Harris, Brooklyn (S.5927-A, A.9413-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Andrews, S.7190, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to Jacquesline Menaged, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1330, Lot No. 32 on the tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: In rem, Jacquesline Menaged, Brooklyn (S.7190)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.2365-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Aubry, Seddio, Cymbrowitz and Lavelle, et al, A.5175-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing correction members of the New York city employees’ retirement system to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of child care leave”.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese and Morahan, S.7500, and Committee on Rules, A.11580, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to providing for medical review for employees of governmental entities performing emergency medical services in the city of New York who apply for disability pension benefits”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Providing for medical review for employees of governmental entities performing emergency medical services (S.7500, A.11580)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Volker, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Padavan, S.6450-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10189-A, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to the payment of salary of certain peace officers”.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Marchi and Leibell, S.3299-B, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5982-B, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5931-A, and Assembly Member Weprin, A.9417-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to sell and convey certain property to Yeshiva Har Torah”.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Committee on Rules, S.7461, and, Committee on Rules, A.10879, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owners Martin Lee and Annette Lee, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 6046, Lot No. 9 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
